data.title: Top K Frequent Elements
data.body:
Given an integer array `nums` and an integer `k`, return the `k` most frequent elements. You may return the answer in any order.

You must solve it in better than O(n log n) time complexity.
constraints: k is in the range [1, the number of unique elements in nums]
data.editorialBody: Use a hashmap to count the frequency of each element. Then, either use a heap of size `k` to keep track of the top `k` elements, or use bucket sort to group elements by frequency. Finally, extract the top `k` frequent values in linear time.
hints: Build a hashmap to count the frequency of each number.
Use a heap or bucket sort to extract the top `k` frequent elements.
Think about how to improve the time complexity to better than O(n log n).

testCases.explanation: 1 and 2 are the two most frequent elements.
2 and 3 appear twice, which is more frequent than others.
